title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, principal of Mt. Blue Middle School, criticized for wearing ICE agent costume for Halloween.
The incident occurred off school grounds and is being addressed by the Mt. Blue Regional School Unit #9.
Project Relief Maine called the costume terrifying for immigrant students, citing deportation as traumatic.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez left the game with a head injury but was cleared after passing concussion protocol.
The injury happened during a play when Atlanta's Drake London made a 40-yard catch against Gonzalez in the fourth quarter.
Gonzalez was ready to return, but the Patriots secured the win, managing the clock successfully on their last drive.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected 180 needles in six days from Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting public safety concerns.
Councilor Ed Flynn urges zero tolerance for open drug use; Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly for harm reduction.
Volunteers created an "SOS" with needles to plea for help, emphasizing health risks near children's play areas.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praised Jayson Tatum's Achilles recovery, noting Tatum is ahead of typical rehabilitation timelines with significant progress.
Durant compared Tatum's recovery to his own, highlighting medical advances and Tatum's ability to dunk six months post-surgery.
Tatum remains hopeful for a return in the 2025-26 season, with Durant supporting the possibility given Tatum's continuous progress.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings both scored touchdowns in the Patriots' 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Douglas and Jennings, childhood friends, played amid personal tragedy after a close family friend was killed.
Douglas recorded a career-high 100-yard game, while Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown as a recent roster addition.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots win 24-23 against Falcons at Gillette Stadium, despite turnovers by Drake Maye contributing to 10 Atlanta points.
Head coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes maintaining joy and positivity after close win, despite team's inconsistent performance.
Quarterback Drake Maye critical of his turnovers but highlights overall resilience and learning opportunities from the game.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren, aged 55, died unexpectedly at his home in Newton on Sunday; no cause announced.
Warren was the first African American elected mayor in Massachusetts, serving Newton from 2009 to 2018.
Warren recently served as Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard's Kennedy School and taught public policy.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots secure their sixth consecutive win, defeating the Falcons despite Drake Maye's two turnovers.
DeMario Douglas shines with his first career 100-yard game, including a 58-yard catch from Drake Maye.
Marcus Jones struggles as Falcons exploit height mismatch for key touchdowns in the red zone.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey by Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows decline in residents feeling 'less safe', from 70.6% in 2024 to 33.7% in 2025.
Public Safety Summit addressed issues such as drug use, petty crime, and cleanliness, despite improvements in violent crimes and overdose deaths.
Retail vacancies downtown at lowest rate since pandemic, attributed to increased safety perception by Downtown Boston Alliance President Michael Nichols.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots win sixth consecutive game, beating Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium.
Drake Maye records 259 passing yards, two touchdowns, but commits two turnovers.
Falcons' missed extra point by Parker Romo secures Patriots' narrow victory.
